page.title: 01The Town of Penrith
page.content: Penrith is an ancient market town and the chief town in the Eden District of Cumbria. It is the centre of administration, and a service area for the surrounding rural community. The town is now by-passed by the M6 motorway, but it is still an important road junction, and has been since Roman times. Penrith is called "The Northern Gateway" to the Lake district. The town is quiet during the winter months, as the people of Penrith carry on with their daily lives. Things change during the summer months as the tourist season starts. Penrith becomes a very busy town, and a centre for the tourists, because there is easy access to the lakes and fells, and the beautiful surrounding country side.
